terms.definition: Product Requirements Document - a detailed blueprint that outlines all product characteristics, features, and capabilities to guide development teams
A comprehensive document that serves as a blueprint for product development, detailing features, capabilities, and requirements for technical teams
Written materials that explain how to use, maintain, or understand technical products, systems, or processes
Individuals or groups who have an interest in or are affected by a project, including team members, customers, and business partners
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing multiple people to collaborate and maintain revision history
A specific scenario or situation that describes how a user will interact with a product or feature to achieve a particular goal
Measurable indicators used to evaluate whether a product or project has achieved its intended goals and objectives
Predetermined standards and requirements that a product must meet before it can be launched or released to users
The minimum hardware, software, and environmental specifications needed for a product to function properly
The defined boundaries of a project, including what features and functionalities are included or excluded from development
The final consumers or individuals who will actually use the product or system being developed
A cross-functional group of professionals responsible for designing, developing, and managing a product throughout its lifecycle
A pre-designed document format or structure that provides a standardized framework for creating consistent documentation
Significant checkpoints or achievements in a project timeline that mark the completion of major phases or deliverables
The process of evaluating a product by testing it with real users to identify usability issues and gather feedback
